title: Stern-Gerlach: Spin-X measured on Z-axis
description: Formal proof that a spin-x state measured on the z-axis produces a 50/50 probability split, as predicted by the QBP quaternion framework and observed in the Stern-Gerlach experiment.

nodes.name: isPureQuaternion
nodes.physical_meaning: Definition encoding QBP Axiom 2: observables are pure quaternions (scalar part = 0).

nodes.name: vecDot
nodes.physical_meaning: Dot product of vector parts: measures alignment between state and observable axes.

nodes.name: spin_x_is_pure
nodes.physical_meaning: SPIN_X = i is a valid observable (pure quaternion).

nodes.name: spin_z_is_pure
nodes.physical_meaning: SPIN_Z = k is a valid observable (pure quaternion).

nodes.name: spinXState
nodes.physical_meaning: Experiment state: particle with spin along +x axis (quaternion i).

nodes.name: spinZObservable
nodes.physical_meaning: Measurement axis: spin measured along z axis (quaternion k).

nodes.name: spinXState_is_pure
nodes.physical_meaning: The spin-x state satisfies the pure quaternion requirement.

nodes.name: spinZObservable_is_pure
nodes.physical_meaning: The spin-z observable satisfies the pure quaternion requirement.

nodes.name: x_z_orthogonal
nodes.physical_meaning: The x and z spin axes are perpendicular: their dot product is zero.

nodes.name: expectation_orthogonal_is_zero
nodes.statement: (ψ O : Q) (_hψ : isPureQuaternion ψ) (_hO : isPureQuaternion O) (h_ortho : vecDot ψ O = 0) : expectationValue ψ O = 0 := by
nodes.physical_meaning: General principle: when state and observable axes are perpendicular, expectation value is zero.

nodes.name: expectation_x_measured_z_is_zero
nodes.physical_meaning: Core result: <O_z> = 0 for spin-x state. Average measurement is zero.
